CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - State to pay outstanding judgment debt;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the village of GPE , GPE region , GPE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against his former employer , the ORG - owned “ ORG ” company , to recover salary arrears . On DATE the court awarded the applicant UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL in salary arrears and compensation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG returned the writ of execution to the applicant on the ground that the debtor lacked funds that could be attached and the court had prohibited seizure of the debtor ’s accounts .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , following the applicant ’s complaint , ordered ORG to renew the enforcement proceedings in the case .
CARDINAL . The judgment in the applicant ’s favour remains unenforced .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
